titleStmt.title: The unjust uncle: or, The perjur'd maid of Essex's unfortunate destiny: who having made a solemn contract with a young man of that same county, was perswaded by her uncle to forsake him and marry another: for which, as a just example of her inconstancy, she dy'd in their presence so soon as she broke her vows. To the tune of The languishing swain. Licensed according to order.

The unjust uncle: or, The perjur'd maid of Essex's unfortunate destiny: who having made a solemn contract with a young man of that same county, was perswaded by her uncle to forsake him and marry another: for which, as a just example of her inconstancy, she dy'd in their presence so soon as she broke her vows. To the tune of The languishing swain. Licensed according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J[osiah]. Blare, at the Looking-Glass on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Publisher's name, date and place of publication from Wing.
Verse: "You youthful damsels far and near ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
